column4: stupid question .. i'm a little confused about how ubuntu does package updates .. when I check the 'Update Manager', it only ever lists security updates .. in 4 months I've never seen a regular application upgrade .. is that because of a setting I have somewhere? can I change something so that I can install regular application upgrades that aren't related to security problems?
sudo apt-get upgrade
or sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
thanks
your welcome . was afk
4 months huh . should get a decent upgrade hehe
i did 'sudo apt-get -s upgrade scite' and got nothing .. i'm assuming there's a new package out there (i'm 3 versions behind), but I don't really know how to check to make sure
i also did 'sudo apt-get update'
apt-cache policy package will give you installed version and installable version
nothing out there  .. that's weird!
package is scite?
in Gutsy the version is 1.71-1
so either ubuntu packages get updated VERY slowly or I'm still doing something wrong
do sudo apt-get upgrade and see what it gives you. let me know also
the only thing it thinks it can upgrade is 'elinks-lite'
and i think that's a security update
then that is all that has been upgraded
in 4 months? argh
possibly.
have you tried sudo apt-get dist-upgrade?
sorry, still not working, but i've got to run ..wifey is yelling at me to clean
thanks, though ;p
